intro: Geraea canescens, commonly known as the silver geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its use in both garden and horticultural settings.
